likes.liked: — The size of the villa and the staff

reviews.text: Traveling from the USA we were delighted our shuttle to AKA (from Bangkok) arrived right on time and most importantly stocked with refreshments. The journey to AKA was fast and effective.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort

likes.liked: — Private sundrenched Pool, seperate bedrooms with own outdoor bathrooms
likes.disliked: — Slippery outside areas, lots of walkways with openings, can easily and did slip over in wet

reviews.text: Upon arrival we were served mango ice cream and tea in the wonderful, authentic reception area (lost count of how many varieties of tea we were served during the stay!) – followed by a golf cart ride to our luxury 2-bed villa.
reviews.title: Peace and relaxation at the AKA Guti

likes.liked: — Having a private pool with an amazing vista
likes.disliked: — The mossies in the evening which is probably the price you have to pay for the hideaway location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The villa (small home!) far exceeded our high expectations…our permanent cheer fitted right in as Thailand is the “land of smiles.” We especially loved the breathtaking view, privacy and all round tranquility not to mention the amazing villa pool and in/out door bathroom. The whole resort is spectacular.
reviews.title: A haven of peace and calm

likes.liked: — The high walls around each villa
likes.disliked: — The outside bath could not be used because of insects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.Poor maintenance of the villas:wornwoodwork, worn furniture, bathroom fixtures, broken shower head, leaking pipes-and the place is two years old!! and of the landscape (during our stay some gardeners where brought to do some gardening, before the visit of the owners-the place cried for some gardening)
reviews.title: Worse experience in Thailand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2.Low level bed furnishings (sheets, pillows, mattress- more like of a 2 star hotel- cheap). Low level furniture, uneasy feeling of not finding a place to organize one's stuff, very low nightstands of 25x35 cm. Dark rooms without a lighten spot for shaving and make up or for reading.
reviews.title: Very private, beautiful, very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3.Very low safety level: my wife strained her leg and her arm and hit her head on a water trap in the entrance to the villa. We had to take her to the hospital, X-ray her foot. She was on crutches for 3 days after this incident. My wife is still in a lot of pain when she walks and she cannot drive, since the straining was in the right foot. Her hand hurts too and we have a head CT scheduled. Not only there is a water trap at the entrance of the villa- the area is not well lit at all. No one warned us of this potential danger. No one turned on the light.
reviews.title: Fabulously Impressive Pool Villa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the wooden deck around the pool gets too hot to step on it. The pool walls are poorly built, I is easy for anyone to fall and hit its back or head (we were extremely careful after the accident my wife had and therefore we noticed these safety faults).
reviews.title: Superb

likes.liked: — The private pool, restaurant, price, total experience.

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the 2 room villas and it does not disappoint. Plenty of space, with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a private pool and a living (TV) room, as well as private sundecks.
reviews.title: Nice stay at AKA

likes.liked: — Wide open spaces that are very well decorated
likes.disliked: — Location and potholes on the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit too far from Hua Hin town for my liking as the road to the resort is quite far and bumpy. However, I am absolutely sure you will not find this kind of space elsewhere near the beach.
reviews.title: A land of zen

reviews.text: To reach the villas you need to take a buggy ride (driven by staff). Though the ride isn't long, it can be an inconvenience as you have to call for them to pick you up just for you to leave the resort. For the same reason, room service etc. can be a little on the slow side. Having said that, staff were pleasant and the resort itself is a marvel.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay when in Hua Hin...

reviews.text: Bathrooms can be a problem for those who do not like creepy crawlies. A few bugs here and there due to the fact that you get your own outdoor bathtub, as well as semi covered rain shower. However, the toilet and sinks are indoor. Please note though that it is the 'nature' concept of the resort and I wouldn't consider having some bugs around as an oversight on the hotel's part, as it is unavoidable if you'd like to have an outdoor bathing experience.
reviews.title: Relax holiday with the natural ambience..

reviews.text: If you'd like to experience Hua Hin center (market) or the actual Hua Hin beach itself, or do not have access to a car, go elsewhere but AKA still packs a punch when it comes to minimalist wide open spaces.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

description: AKA Resort Hua Hin offers luxury villas inspired by Thailand’s meditative traditions. Tucked away in the hills of Hua Hin, the resort’s private villas showcase elegant design and modern amenities. Personal infinity pools and luxury spas provide guests with a private oasis amidst Thailand’s tropical landscape. Reflecting Hua Hin’s unique cultural heritage, AKA Resort Hua Hin is a rejuvenating and luxurious retreat from the stresses of daily life. Each villa is infused with an ambience of tranquility, permeating the pools, terraces, and sala rooftop gardens.AKA Resort Guti translates Thailand’s traditional monastery experience into an exclusive villa getaway. Nestled in the hills of Hua Hin, the resort offers private villas, each one inspired by meditative Thai traditions and elegant Thai architecture. With infinity pools and garden terraces, the exclusive villas provide relaxing sanctuaries amidst tropical landscapes and panoramic view of Hua Hin. Hua Hin’s history as a retreat destination for Thailand’s monarchy affords the area with an air of nobility and tranquility, steeped in traditional Thai luxury.
